full_title_en: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index 2000 (SLEDAI-2K)

seo.meta_description_en: The Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index 2000 (SLEDAI-2K) stratifies severity of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
seo.keywords_en: SLE, clinical activity, sle severity, sle activity

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the SLEDAI-2K for Lupus and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.advice_en: Do you use the SLEDAI-2K for Lupus and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

about.more_info_en:
Interpretation:

The most appropriate SLEDAI-2K cut-off score for definition of active disease which links to the need to increase therapy is 3 or 4, and trending changes over time in order to help with decision-making is recommended (Yee 2011).

Original/Primary Reference.text: Gladman DD, Ibañez D, Urowitz MB. Systemic lupus erythematosus disease activity index 2000. J Rheumatol. 2002;29(2):288-91.

Validation.text: Yee CS, Farewell VT, Isenberg DA, et al. The use of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus Disease Activity Index-2000 to define active disease and minimal clinically meaningful change based on data from a large cohort of systemic lupus erythematosus patients. Rheumatology (Oxford). 2011;50(5):982-8.

creator_info.about_en: Dafna D. Gladman, MD, FRCPC, is a senior scientist at the Krembil Research Institute in Ontario, Canada. She is also the deputy director of the Centre for Prognosis Studies in The Rheumatic Diseases at Toronto Western Hospital. Dr. Gladman’s primary research is focused on psoriatic arthritis, systemic lupus erythematosus, and rheumatoid arthritis.
